summary: Orion is a well-known group of stars in the night sky during winter in the Northern Hemisphere. It is named after a hunter from Greek myths and is one of the 88 modern constellations. Orion includes two very bright stars, Rigel and Betelgeuse, which are among the brightest in the sky. The constellation also has a pattern of three stars called Orion's Belt. Additionally, Orion is home to a meteor shower called the Orionids and a bright nebula.
title: Orion (constellation)
